synthesis_conditions.notes: The intentional addition of water produced interpenetrated (2) and polyrotaxane (3 and 4) isomers.

synthesis_conditions.NMR_observations: Appearance of cyclobutane peaks at 5.01 ppm along with other peaks owing to aromatic protons in the region 8.7–8.8 ppm and 7.7–8.0 ppm
synthesis_conditions.notes: Attempts to transform 4 into 3 and vice-versa by soaking the single crystals in different solvents did not retain the single-crystal nature.
Quantitative photo-cycloaddition of bpeb with trans–cis–trans conformation confirmed the formation of the structure.
Ground and dispersed in DMF for PL studies.

synthesis_conditions.PL_quenching: Highest PL quenching up to about one seventh of the initial fluorescence intensity in 90 mm (17.8 ppm) solution

synthesis_conditions.notes: Similar quenching properties as 4, with best selectivity with 2,4-DNPH.
